summary: This bill, the Natural Disaster Resilience and Recovery Accountability Act, establishes a Commission within the Office of Management and Budget to examine and recommend reforms to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the federal government's approach to natural disaster resilience and recovery. The Commission will consist of 15 members appointed by the Director, with a focus on expertise in relevant fields. The Commission will submit a final report with recommendations to improve the federal approach to disaster recovery, including policy recommendations and a review of federally funded programs. The Commission has a strict timeline to get the project done and will submit interim reports.
